page.title: 18Public services
page.content: The nearest hospital to Whittlesey is Peterborough, but there is a health centre in the town that is visited by certain specialists as well as being a local doctors surgery. The ambulance cover is provided from Peterborough and takes up to 12 minutes to arrive. There is a dental surgery which is used by about a third of the people. The towns police station is manned for about 18 hours of the day. This also covers some nearby villages. The local fire service operates from Stanground about 7 miles away and is on call 24 hours. Fenland District Council collect household rufuse weekly and tip in at Fengate in Peterborough. Sewerage is treated in the town by Fenland District Council who act as agents for the Anglia Water Authority.
